resource.chars:
4thly there are the large ‘sinuses’ of the 
mantle & the ‘visceral cavity’ into 
which they open 
To determine in what way these 
parts are connected and what functions should be ascribed to each, it appears to 
me, that much further research is 
required -
<u>Nervous System of Terebratulidae <\u>
Prof. Owen describes & figures the central part 
of this system as a ring surrounding 
the oral aperture - its inferior portion 
being constituted by a mere commissural 
band -
M. Gratiolet however states with 
justice that the inferior side of this collar 
is the thicker - and I find both 
in <u>Rhynchonella <\u> & in Waldheimia 
that it <s>is<\s> constitutes, in fact, a distinct oblong
